last_episode_to_air.name: Call Me a Donut Wall
last_episode_to_air.overview: Randi and Carter decide to get married at the courthouse; things take a turn for the worse when Kat accidentally gets Randi's wedding ring stuck on her finger; country superstar Russell Dickerson offers Max a life-changing career opportunity.

name: Call Me Kat
overview: Kat is a woman who struggles every day against society and her mother to prove that she can still live a happy and fulfilling life despite still being single at 39. Which is why she recently spent her entire savings to open a cat café in Louisville, Kentucky.

episodes.name: Plus One
episodes.overview: Kat's former crush and good friend returns to town.

episodes.name: Double Date
episodes.overview: Kat's mom sets her daughter up on a blind date, but it happens to be the same night that Max asks her to be his karaoke partner. Kat's employee Randi confronts a customer who never tips.

episodes.name: Vacation
episodes.overview: Kat wins a free trip to Puerto Rico for herself and a friend, but she doesn't have anyone to go with her. After being left in charge of the cafe, Randi and Phil have trouble with the new register.

episodes.name: Therapy
episodes.overview: Sheila comes to stay with Kat to avoid being home alone. Sheila's lack of boundaries lead them to try therapy. Meanwhile, Phil and Randi make a road trip to buy Phil's mother medicinal marijuana.

episodes.name: Cake
episodes.overview: A customer asks the café to bake his wedding cake, but it’s a tricky situation for Phil. Meanwhile, Kat tries to figure out where her relationship with Max stands.

episodes.name: Gym
episodes.overview: When Kat gets selected as a finalist for the Louisville Courier Journal's 'Twenty under Forty' list, she decides to join the local gym to try to get in shape. Meanwhile, Randi and Daniel struggle to take their relationship to the next level.

episodes.name: Eggs
episodes.overview: After a visit to the gynecologist takes an unexpected turn, Kat must consider freezing her eggs if she ever wants to have children. Meanwhile, Max and Carter help Phil with his online dating to prevent him from getting catfished, but it turns out Phil may be the one catfishing.

episodes.name: All Nighter
episodes.overview: When Randi's cousin comes to town, Kat and Phil convince Randi to let them come out with her to prove they aren't old. Meanwhile, Randi struggles to figure out why Daniel doesn't get jealous.

episodes.name: First Date
episodes.overview: Kat deals with nerves over her first date with Oscar; Randi tries to figure out the perfect anniversary gift for Daniel.

episodes.name: Business Council
episodes.overview: When Carter helps Kat get elected to the local business council, a rift forms in their friendship when she doesn't vote in his favor to keep the bar open later; Sheila asks Max to help her move some of her furniture to make room for her boyfriend.

episodes.name: Moving In
episodes.overview: With Daniel out of town on the day of Randi's big move to his place, Kat offers to help her and discovers an unexpected secret about Daniel's past; Max offers to help tutor Carter's son in English.

episodes.name: Salsa
episodes.overview: Kat asks Max to help her learn how to salsa dance to impress Oscar; Phil bakes a bun that looks exactly like a celebrity.

episodes.name: Cat-A-Versary
episodes.overview: When one of the oldest cats in the café dies unexpectedly, Kat decides to turn the one-year anniversary of the Cat Café into his funeral; Kat, Randi and Oscar all try to make amends for mistakes they made.

episodes.name: Call Me Kerfuffled
episodes.overview: The cast of "Blossom" reunites for a celebrity charity golf tournament; Kat struggles with a romantic crisis.

episodes.name: Call me by my Middle Name
episodes.overview: Kat struggles to find the perfect way to celebrate her anniversary; Randi and Carter continue to navigate their new relationship.

episodes.name: Call Me A Sporty Giant
episodes.overview: While staying in Kat's apartment, Randi starts to feel overwhelmed by Kat's quirks. Meanwhile, Max and Carter try to teach Phil how to ride a bike.

episodes.name: Call Me Forty
episodes.overview: Oscar attempts multiple surprises to celebrate Kat's 40th birthday, including meeting his mother.

episodes.name: Call Me Your Biggest Fan
episodes.overview: Kat pushes Max to enter a jingle contest being held at the Middle C to boost his confidence. Meanwhile, Carter doesn't know how to react when Randi puts nail polish on his son.

episodes.name: Call Me Unfaithful
episodes.overview: When Randi sees Sheila's boyfriend out with another woman, she and Kat decide to investigate, but can't decided if they should tell Sheila. Meanwhile, Randi looks for a new apartment and Oscar gets Max and Carter to try yoga.

episodes.name: Call Me Cupcake
episodes.overview: When Phil leaves on a last-minute vacation with Sheila to cheer her up, Oscar steps up to help in the café, causing tension with Randi. Meanwhile, Max and Carter make a bet to start a juice cleanse.

episodes.name: Call Me Señor Don Gato
episodes.overview: Kat joins Carter to wait in line to score exclusive sneakers for his son. Then, while trying to have a relaxing night in, Randi is pulled into giving advice to Max and Phil, and Sheila tries to get Oscar to stand up for himself.

episodes.name: Call Me Irresponsible
episodes.overview: When Max gets evicted from his apartment, due to his lack of financial control, he asks Kat for help with managing his money. Meanwhile, Phil decides he is too reliant on technology and gives up his phone, and Randi agrees to take pictures of Sheila for her dating profile.

episodes.name: Call Me Katzilla
episodes.overview: When Kat winds up getting sick just days before her favorite local TV newsman plans a visit to the cafe, she turns in to her alter ego, Katzilla; after Randi lands her dream apartment, Max starts trying to find his own.

episodes.name: Call Me the Bad Boy of Cheese
episodes.overview: Kat tries to welcome a new business to the neighborhood, but the owner thinks he can get away with whatever he wants. Meanwhile, Randi tries to figure out a great gift for Carter.

episodes.name: Call Me a McCluckhead
episodes.overview: Sheila convinces Kat and Oscar to join her on a double date with a man who owns a local chain restaurant. Meanwhile, Randi and Max adjust to their new rooming situation.

episodes.name: Call Me a Kingbirdie
episodes.overview: Max gets a job writing a song for a social media savvy teenage popstar that doesn't go as well as he planned. Meanwhile, Phil and Oscar convince Kat to join their bowling team.

episodes.name: Call Me Cupid
episodes.overview: Oscar and Kat try to set Max up with a woman named Nicole. Kat has a hard time not feeling territorial over her relationship with Max. Meanwhile, Randi, Carter and Phil spy on Randi's loud neighbors.

episodes.name: Call Me Tiny Boo-Boo
episodes.overview: Kat has to deal with the consequences of her past actions and make a big decision about her relationship. Meanwhile, Max tries to figure out a great plan for his third date with Nicole.

episodes.name: Call Me What the Kat Dragged In
episodes.overview: While Kat deals with the blowback from her big relationship change, she leans on Nick to help her bounce back. Meanwhile, Randi deals with Carter’s newfound presence in her apartment.

episodes.name: Call Me Flatch
episodes.overview: Kat rents her apartment to Kelly and Shrub from Flatch, Ohio; Max plans to play one of his original songs for Robin Thicke at a local fundraiser.

episodes.name: Call Me Shellfish
episodes.overview: While Kat struggles to keep her anxiety under control, she comes up with a plan to save the cafe; Max finally gets his big break; Carter struggles with his jealousy.

episodes.name: Call Me Ken Jennings
episodes.overview: After taking some time to travel and decompress, Kat is on her way back to Louisville when she is upgraded to first class and seated next to “Jeopardy!’s” winningest contestant, Ken Jennings, on her flight home. Upon arrival, she discovers some significant changes have been made to the cafe by Randi and Phil and Randi’s passion for her job is now straining her relationship with Carter. Max has returned home from his time in Nashville pursuing his music career, with cowboy boots and a big ego to go along with them.

episodes.name: Call Me Skeeter Juice
episodes.overview: It's time for Sheila to renew her driver's license, but she refuses to go take the test; Phil urges the group to try his mama's moonshine despite their skepticism; Max finally sells a song to be used in a national commercial.

episodes.name: Call Me Thor
episodes.overview: Kat spends the day with Max and his nephew, Thor, and realizes she enjoys being around a baby.

episodes.name: Call Me Donor Four-Five-Seven
episodes.overview: Kat decides that she would like to pursue motherhood and her friends jump at the chance to help her find a donor.

episodes.name: Call Me Uncle Dad
episodes.overview: Carter hosts a Halloween Octoberfest party at The Middle C, but struggles to get customers in; Kat continues her journey to find a donor; Phil has a great night with a potential love interest.

episodes.name: Call Me the Hot Chick Two
episodes.overview: Kat and Max finally go on a first date, after a steamy hookup, but they can't seem to act like themselves; Carter attempts to train his son for track but realizes Randi might make a better coach.

episodes.name: Call Me Dame Booty Clench
episodes.overview: Kat is drained from helping Sheila run errands all over town; Phil is exhausted from partying every night with his new boyfriend; Carter needs a self-esteem boost.

episodes.name: Call Me Fancy Puffenstuff
episodes.overview: Kat's Murder Mystery-themed Friendsgiving dinner isn't a crowdpleaser, and Phil has a romantic dilemma. Meanwhile, Kat tries to encourage Max's career ambitions, but she worries that he has a bigger problem.

episodes.name: Call Me Chrismukkah
episodes.overview: Kat joins Max at his rock climbing gym to keep a close eye on him. Meanwhile, Carter has to spice up the bar after being excluded from a Christmas pub crawl.

episodes.name: Call Me Philliam
episodes.overview: Phil's mother shows up at Kat's Cafe to fill in as baker while Phil is away.

guest_stars.character: Self - Guest Star (In Memoriam of Leslie Jordan)
guest_stars.name: Dolly Parton

episodes.name: Call Me Prescription Roulette
episodes.overview: Sheila grows jealous after Kat hits it off with her new retirement home friends. Meanwhile, Randi tries to find a way to tell Carter that she doesn't like her engagement ring.

episodes.name: Call Me Ichabod Evel Knievel
episodes.overview: Kat hires a new baker, Gideon at the Kat Cafe and shows him around town; Max and Carter wingman for Sheila.

episodes.name: Call Me Fatty Patty
episodes.overview: In celebration of Max's birthday, Kat, Randi and Carter jointly gift him an RV rental so they can roadtrip to the Smoky Mountains together. Gideon  decides to join in on the trip, while Randi and Carter bicker over where they should live together.

episodes.name: Call Me Better Than Paul Rudd
episodes.overview: Kat and Max move in together and host a Super Bowl party in their new apartment but face some relationship trouble along the way; Randi tries to make some extra cash.

episodes.name: Call Me 'Cat's in The Cradle'
episodes.overview: Max receives a surprise visit from his dad for the first time in 30 years; Sheila and Gideon help Randi and Carter renovate their condo.

episodes.name: Call Me Worth The Wait
episodes.overview: When Kat becomes jealous after hearing a song Max wrote, she tries to plan a romantic evening for the two of them to spice up their relationship; Randi learns how to be a cool yet responsible stepmom.

episodes.name: Call Me Lady Avenger
episodes.overview: Sheila must supplement her savings after moving to Valley Hills, which has turned out to be quite an expensive senior community; Randi and Carter think about the future of their family.

episodes.name: Call Me Toilet Roboto
episodes.overview: Max hosts singer Zoey Monroe in hopes of advancing his career as a songwriter and although jealous at first, Kat develops a liking to her; Carter punctures a pipe inside a kitchen cabinet causing a flood in the condo. Randi and Carter find themselves staying at Sheila's for the time being.

episodes.name: Call Me Not Okurr
episodes.overview: In the heat of the moment, Zoey kisses Kat at karaoke night. Zoey hopes this moment can be kept between the two of them, but Kat struggles to keep the kiss a secret from Max; Randi discovers a secret hideaway, that she hides from Carter and transforms into a place for her to unwind.

episodes.name: Call Me Consciously Uncoupled
episodes.overview: Kat and Max have some news to share, but attempt to keep it a secret until after Sheila's big birthday bash; Carter breaks a pre-wedding superstition and thinks he is cursed.

episodes.name: Call Me Pretty Kitty
episodes.overview: To take her mind off their breakup and Max and Zoey's new successful song, Kat attends a cat show with Sheila and Randi. Kat's competitive side is brought to life, when local cat lover Val thinks Kat and her rescue cat have no chance of bringing home a trophy. Meanwhile, Max's ex, Brigette, attempts to rekindle a romance with him.

episodes.name: Call Me a Donut Wall
episodes.overview: Randi and Carter decide to get married at the courthouse; things take a turn for the worse when Kat accidentally gets Randi's wedding ring stuck on her finger; country superstar Russell Dickerson offers Max a life-changing career opportunity.
